intro: Lippia campestris, commonly known as Mexican mint or wild mint, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually white or purple, arranged in clusters. Lippia campestris is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its pleasant aroma and potential health benefits.
